algorithm_technique: Brute-force iteration through all pairs of rectangles to find intersection dimensions and calculate maximum square area.
problem_summary_simple: Find the largest square that fits within the overlapping area of any two given rectangles.
problem_summary_technical: Iterates through all pairs of rectangles, calculates the intersection rectangle's dimensions, and finds the maximum possible square side length within these intersections.
key_insights: The intersection of two rectangles is also a rectangle.
The side length of the largest square that can fit inside a rectangle is limited by the minimum of its width and height.
The problem can be solved by checking all pairs of rectangles and finding the maximum possible square area within their intersections.
